Message:
As Ophelia’s hands quivered
upon receiving my sword,
she spoke through the tears
welling in her eyes.

“I alone cannot bear the weight
of this sword, Your Majesty.
Thus...please allow me to make
but one request.”

“Just as you have requested of me,
I, too, wish for you to take my life
into your hands.”

As Ophelia’s anxious words
leave her mouth, she takes
her own knightly blade,
“Oathkeeper,”
and presents it to me.

“Should a time arise in which
I betray my loyalty to you...
I beg of you, Your Majesty.
Please, take this sword and—!”

I did not give her a chance
to finish her words,
when I swiftly took
her sword into my hands.

Tears run down our cheeks.
Our promise to take
each other’s lives was,
to us, our solace.

On this day, we vowed
to entrust our fates and
our swords to one another...
as if binding our lives
together in chains.
